rComments: Evil. Hardest teacher ever, and least sympathetic. Literally made me want to kill myself at times.

Maria is a great piano instructor. She is definitely strict and if you're not good at piano, she will tell you you suck. but if you practice enough and meet her high expectations, she can definitely help you improve your musical understanding and interpretation and become a much pianist.

Although Maria is possibly the biggest hardass of the music department, her ear training instruction is top notch. If you can put up with the rigorous practice and performance she expects of her students, she will turn even the tone deaf into amazingly accurate ears

Can be intimidating, but really pushes you to challenge yourself.  Personally I've always found her teaching method very helpful and haven't really had much trouble with the class.  Tests can be very challenging though, especially when it comes to recognizing digressions and key changes in a progression.

Maria is an extremely strict professor, but her instructions will definitely help you improve dramatically. She is an amazing pianist and she tries so hard to help you become one too. Although she can be a little too harsh sometimes, the experience you gain and the improvements you make are definitely worth it. Just be prepared to practice A LOT!
